content: to a toy safety directive 2009/48/ec all toys must meet the essential safety requirements outlined in this directive including physical mechanical chemical and flammability standards b en 71 standards a en 71-1 ensure toys have no small parts that could pose choking hazards b en 71-2 use materials that are not easily flammable c en 71-3 verify that yarn stuffing and embellishments are free from harmful chemicals c reach regulation ensure that all materials comply with the registration evaluation authorization and restriction of chemicals reach standards avoiding substances like phthalates lead and cadmium 6 risk assessment and testing a conduct a risk assessment for the finished toy to identify potential hazards such as loose parts or sharp edges b perform durability tests to ensure the toy can withstand normal use without breaking c consider obtaining certification from an accredited laboratory to confirm compliance with eu safety standards 7 not for use by children these crochet patterns are not intended for use by children under the age of 14 unless under direct adult supervision if making items for children ensure the finished product meets relevant safety standards and has been tested for safety for patterns requiring small components such as buttons glass gems safety eyes wire plastic canvas etc ensure these are securely attached and kept away from children to prevent choking hazards 8 disclaimer this document is provided for informational purposes only users are responsible for ensuring compliance with local regulations and safety standards
